author: wsjcom
title: EHRs Have Their Problems But at Least They’re Legible
text: Regarding the letters of March 27 on the move to electronic health records: Think about those of us who must read and attempt to decipher physicians’ formerly handwritten chart notes. Chicken scratch is too mild a description and may be insulting to chickens. I am a retired Social Security administrative law judge. Most of my work involved disability determinations. People apply for benefits and claim to be disabled. Medical records from treating (physician) sources drive the decision. Too much time is devoted in attempting to decipher physicians’ handwriting. This is wasted government employee time, because physicians...
